page.title: 03Development of Winmarleigh
page.content: After the Wilson-Pattens bought the manor they held it as absentee lords, like many another.However the indust- rial growth of Warrington,pressing in upon Bank Hall,persuaded Colonel John Wilson-Patten to rebuild a new residence in Winmarleigh,where he came annually to shoot and course.This move brought great change and benefit. From about 1850 onwards the Colonel had been improving land by drainage and enclosure,reclaiming bog and repairing and rebuilding property. It is from 1870,at the time of the building of the{Hall,}that the work gained impetus. The present village with a church,a school,a Hall and parkland,a large vicarage and good former labourers' cottages,post-dates 1870.The village in those days in particular owed a debt of gratitude to Colonel John.
